results.title: FleshPool
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Julie Rrap
results.brief_description: Julie Rrap’s unconventional nude study uses digital imaging to stunning effect, creating a fleshy mutant form as a woman slides into her own reflection.
results.description: Julie Rrap’s unconventional nude study uses digital imaging to stunning effect, creating a fleshy mutant form as a woman slides into her own reflection.
description_for_label: Julie Rrap’s unconventional nude study uses digital imaging to stunning effect, creating a fleshy mutant form as a woman slides into her own reflection.

results.title: The Day Before I Went Away
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guo Jian
results.brief_description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.
results.description: Guo Jian’s saucy and sinister reappropriation of Chinese propaganda painting techniques is heightened by this animation of his allegorical work ‘The Day Before I Went Away’.

results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Craig Walsh
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.
results.description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.
description_for_label: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Scott Redford
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis BuÃ±uel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Cherine Fahd
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
results.description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.
description_for_label: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.

results.title: The Other side
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Zaljko Radic
results.brief_description: A 3D animation without dialogue. Kids will love this simple story with a Jules Verne influence. A moustached man in a brightly coloured flying machine travels through a surreal futuristic landscape searching for a lost city…Created using Lightwave, After FX and Premiere
results.creator_credit_for_label: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Zaljko Radic
results.description: A 3D animation without dialogue. Kids will love this simple story with a Jules Verne influence. A moustached man in a brightly coloured flying machine travels through a surreal futuristic landscape searching for a lost city…Created using Lightwave, After FX and Premiere

results.title: M'eza (preview for an interactive installation)
results.creator_credit: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Anita Bacic
results.brief_description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. M’eza is an immersive art-piece screened at Videobrasil Electronic Art festival 2003. Artist should be contacted at a later date for a further explanation of the work
results.creator_credit_for_label: Advanced Diploma of Multimedia (ADoM), Swinburne University of Technology (formerly Electronic Design and Interactive Media (EDIM) and Anita Bacic
results.description: As part of the end of year screening for the Swinburne, EDIM (Electronic Design and Interactive Media) course - those students who had completed interactive coursework were required to create a linear representation of their work for the showreel. M’eza is an immersive art-piece screened at Videobrasil Electronic Art festival 2003. Artist should be contacted at a later date for a further explanation of the work
